description: Belarus's largest art museum and one of Eastern Europe's richest, housing over 37,000 works spanning 12 centuries from 132 countries. Located in a magnificent 1957 building decorated with allegorical sculptures, it holds the world's largest collection of Belarusian art alongside masterpieces by Russian greats like Repin, Levitan, and Vrubel.
highlights: World's largest collection of Belarusian art
Russian masters: Surikov, Serov, Levitan, Repin, Shishkin, Vrubel
Works by Marc Chagall in graphic collection
Diverse genres: iconography, portraiture, landscapes, impressionism, socialist realism
Allegorical sculptures named Art, Sculpture, and Fame
tips: Plan 2 hours to see main collections comfortably
Tickets 4-8 BYN, discounts last Wednesday of month
Audio guides available in Russian, English, Belarusian
Lectures and special exhibitions regularly scheduled
Affordable admission makes it excellent value
vibe: Culturally enriching, surprisingly comprehensive, accessible - a treasure trove of artistic heritage that reveals Belarus's creative soul across centuries
